page.title: 14SPORT AND LEISURE IN ST.IVES
page.content: { Rugby}has always been the team sport in St.Ives. There is now a fine clubhouse and two good pitches, one with floodlights. Recently{football has begun to take off in St.Ives, though at present the town's soccer team has no pitch of its own and has applied to use a rugby club pitch. { Cricket}has restarted within the last four years. A town team uses the comprehensive school grounds. The town has{squash, judo, bowling, table and {lawn tennis}and{sailing clubs.}There is also a health studio and several hotels with swimming pools. A{golf course has recently been opened in the grounds of Tregenna Castle Hotel. St.Ives is one of the birth places of British{surfing}and Porthmeor beach attracts surfers (and wind surfers) all year round.
